column1: 2 ^ Let God arise
column2: and let his enemies be scattered~; and let them that hate him flee from before his face.

column1: 3 ^ As smoke vanisheth
column2: so let them vanish away~; as wax melteth before the face of fire
column3: so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

column1: 4 ^ And let the just feast
column2: and rejoice before God

column1: 5 ^ Sing ye to God~; sing a psalm to his name~; make a way for him who ascendeth upon the west. The Lord is his name~; rejoice ye before him.
6 ^ They shall be troubled at his presence
column2: the father of orphans and the judge of widows~; God in his holy place.

column1: 7 ^ God who maketh men of one manner to dwell in a house~; who bringeth out them that were bound in strength
column2: in like manner them who provoke

column1: 8 ^ O God
column2: when thou didst go forth in the sight of thy people
column3: when thou didst pass through the desert

column1: 9 ^ the earth was moved
column2: and the heavens dropped before the face of the God of Sinai
column3: before the face of the God of Israel.

column1: 10 ^ Thou shalt set aside for thy inheritance a free rain
column2: O God
column4: but thou hast made it perfect.

column1: 11 ^ In it shall thy animals dwell~; in thy sweetness
column2: O God
column3: thou hast provided for the poor.

column1: 12 ^ The Lord shall give the word to them that preach good tidings with great power.
13 ^ The king of powers is of the beloved
column2: of the beloved
column3: and the beauty of the house shall divide spoils.

column1: 14 ^ If you sleep among the midst of lots
column2: you shall be as the wings of a dove covered with silver
column3: and the hinder parts of her back with the paleness of gold.

column1: 15 ^ When heaven discerns kings to be over her
column2: they shall be whited with snow in Selmon.

column1: 16 ^ O mountain of God
column2: fat mountain~; O curdled mountain

column1: 17 ^ Why suspect
column2: ye curdled mountains
column4: in which God is well pleased to dwell~? For there the Lord shall dwell unto the end.

column1: 18 ^ The chariot of God is attended by ten thousands
column2: thousands of them that rejoice~; the Lord is among them in Sinai

column1: 19 ^ Thou hast ascended on high
column2: thou hast led captivity captive
column3: thou hast received gifts in men~; yea for those also that do not believe
column4: the dwelling of the Lord God.

column1: 20 ^ Blessed be the Lord day by day~; the God of our salvation will make our journey prosperous to us.
21 ^ Our God is the God of salvation
column2: and of the Lord
column3: of the Lord are the ways out from death.

column1: 22 ^ But God shall break the heads of his enemies
column2: the hairy crown of them that walk on in their sins.

column1: 23 ^ The Lord said
column2: "I will turn them from Basan
column3: I will turn them into the depth of the sea

column1: 24 ^ that thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thy enemies~; the tongue of thy dogs be red
column2: by him."

column1: 25 ^ They have seen thy goings
column2: O God
column4: of my king who is in his sanctuary.

column1: 26 ^ Princes went before joined with singers
column2: in the midst of young damsels playing on timbrels.

column1: 27 ^ In the churches bless ye God
column2: the Lord from the fountains of Israel.

column1: 28 ^ There is Benjamin a youth
column2: in ecstasy of mind~; the princes of Judah are their leaders~; the princes of Zabulon

column1: 29 ^ Command thy strength
column2: O God~; confirm this
column4: what thou hast wrought in us.

column1: 30 ^ From thy temple in Jerusalem
column2: kings shall offer presents to thee.

column1: 31 ^ Rebuke the wild beasts of the reeds~; the congregation of bulls with the cows of the people
column2: who seek to exclude them who are tried with silver. Scatter thou the nations that delight in wars.

column1: 32 ^ Ambassadors shall come out of Egypt~; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands to God.
33 ^ Sing to God
column2: ye kingdoms of the earth~; sing ye to the Lord~; Sing ye to God

column1: 34 ^ Who mounteth above the heaven of heavens
column2: to the east~; behold he will give to his voice the voice of power.

column1: 35 ^ Give ye glory to God~; over Israel is his magnificence
column2: and his power is in the clouds.

column1: 36 ^ God is wonderful in his saints~; the God of Israel is he who will give power and strength to his people. Blessed be God.
